result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Boria

defendant.name: Boria, Steven
defendant.address: c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, 1 W Lincoln St  P.O. Box 661, Waupun, WI 53963

records.addlTxt: Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Facility
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot\ listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:48 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Steven Boria appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Steven Boria. Laura Salcido appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

1:45 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Steven Boria appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Steven Boria. Laura Salcido appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Tapia is appointed. 
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT NEXT COURT DATE.
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT DODGE CORRECTIONAL; HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRECTION OF THE TRIAL COURT.  
THE PREFERENCE BY THE DEFENSE IS TO DO ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Boria
Current: c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, 1 W Lincoln St  P.O. Box 661, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: c/o Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States

3:36 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erik Schlueter for attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Defendant Steven Boria not in court, in custody at Milwaukee County Jail. 

The Court notes that the Defendant is currently incarcerated at Milwaukee County Jail.
The Court notes that it tried to get into contact with the Jail with no success.
The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.
The Court will leave the warrant in effect.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Boria
Current: c/o Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 4774 N 31st St, Milwaukee, WI 53209

3:23 PM Defendant Steven Boria not in court.  Attorney Anna Kees for attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Steven Boria.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees states the defendant is currently in custody in Milwaukee and requests to quash the warrant and set this matter on the video calendar.  The Court orders the warrant remain in effect.  The Court will this matter for an initial appearance on the Court's video calendar before Commissioner Bailey.  Clerks office to set up video appearance from Milwaukee County Jail.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
